head.title:
for the ache of disease in the
raynes of the bakke

ab.p:
Take a quarter of yard of redde scarlett & stycche therto
the woll of a blakke shepe thatt growyth apon the
brest and then take pouder of [?]aunders & strew over
the sayd woll & also pouder of lycoras and after
that don to over spryngyll the same with oyle
of oylyff and that plastur shall restore nature.
And ease the pacient of his disease so it be layed
to his raynes & every wyke the same plastre
to be renewed with same pouder & oyle. And so
to use it till he be hoole &c.
